results.description:

results.title: Director, Product
results.description:
Loyal is an organization centered on experience and building a platform that allows consumers to make meaningful decisions when it comes to healthcare. We deeply understand providers, locations, services, appointments, business rules, and moreover, we understand patients -- who they are, the preferred method of communication, upcoming appointments, lapsed appointments, outstanding bills, health risks, and more. With this intelligence, our platform fuels highly relevant and personalized experiences across all mediums (website, email, voice‚Ä¶) allowing patients to get healthy, stay healthy, and have a better relationship with the health care provider.

**This is a remote role**

Job Summary¬†

The Director, Product role is responsible for product planning, strategy and execution for our Digital Front Door and Shared Services division of products. Products in this division include, but are not limited to; Conversational AI, Web Search, Web Scheduling, Data Management, EHR Integrations, and Portal Services.¬†

The Director, Product is responsible for defining the vision for the division and collaborating with other leaders from the engineering, marketing, sales, and operations departments to ensure that financial, customer, and user satisfaction goals are met. This role will also work closely with other Director, Product roles to ensure effective and efficient cross-division coordination. Most importantly, this role is responsible for coaching and growing the product managers within the division.

Job Duties¬†

  • Develop long term strategy, vision and high-level priorities for your product team(s) in alignment with company priorities
  • Continuously engage customers to gain insight into customer needs and represent Loyal‚Äôs products
  • Practice effective internal and external communication, ensuring that priorities, high-profile metrics, and projects are well communicated and well understood
  • Partner with Engineering and Design to foster empowered product delivery teams operating effectively at all levels¬†
  • Collaborate with Leadership, Marketing, Customer Success, and other functional areas to gain new insights, unlock opportunities, and work together more effectively, with a specific focus on enabling go-to-market strategies.
  • Manage cross-team dynamics to ensure the entire team is successful, proactively instituting process improvements across your team, e.g., review and provide feedback on roadmaps, strategic plans and feature specs
  • Coach team members to use modern, effective, and data-driven product management practices to de-risk decisions and create value¬†
  • Plan the structure of your team, managing headcount, succession planning, external hires and internal transfers¬†
  • Motivate your team to ensure they are engaged and connected to the larger company mission

Education and Experience

  • 7+ years of technology product management experience
  • 3+ years of experience managing people¬†
  • Experience working in the healthcare technology space preferred
  • Strong preference for experience integrating with EHRs
  • Experience working within a software as a service (SaaS) company preferred
  • Experience working within a start-up and/or ambiguous environment, with proven experience to be adaptable preferred

¬†

Knowledge and Skills

  • Management: You have directly managed a team of product managers
  • Execution: You have led multiple product teams which are able to execute consistently, delivering quality projects of the broadest scope and impact on time
  • UX: You are passionate about creating intuitive, simple user experiences.¬† You have a strong eye for usability and quality design.¬† You are a strong partner to and advocate for design
  • Technical: You are comfortable working with engineering leadership to prioritize broadly and you understand technical complexities of your product areas
  • Analytical: You have a good grasp of experiment design, statistical analysis and multivariate testing.¬† You can use data to set OKRs, create dashboards to monitor product health, review analyses from across the company and develop basic models. You can construct a narrative for using data in order to drive the decision making process
  • Organizational skills: You are able to manage multiple teams with stakeholders across the organization. You have experience working closely with business & marketing partners
  • Communication: You‚Äôre a strong communicator, both written and orally. You enjoy working with complex concepts and distilling them down so that anyone can understand them. You‚Äôre comfortable working cross functionally with stakeholders and can manage competing needs to drive alignment and resolution
  • Diplomatic: You know how to work with all different types of personalities, and can navigate tough conversations
  • Adaptive: You are curious, optimistic and a skilled problem-solver.¬† You embrace the unknown and are able to adapt to shifts in priorities.You look outside your day to day to ensure you keep learning and growing

¬†

#LI-REMOTE

¬†

We know that potential candidates are often less likely to apply to a position if they don‚Äôt match 100% of the job qualifications. ¬†Don‚Äôt let that be why you miss out on this opportunity! ¬†We encourage you to apply if you can demonstrate many of these skills and competencies.¬†
¬†
Loyal to our employees
¬†
We are a remote-friendly company! We encourage you to apply from anywhere in the United States. We also believe in a work/life balance that fulfills you while you‚Äôre here and supports you when you‚Äôre not. We built our benefits package to prove that we‚Äôre committed to you having everything you need (including a little fun).¬† Here is what we offer full-time employees:
  • Flexible paid time off, sick and personal days
  • At least one holiday per month (sometimes, more!)
  • Full health, dental, and vision insurance - Loyal pays the premium for all employees!
  • One Time Home Office Setup Stipend For Remote & Hybrid Roles
  • Monthly Internet Stipend for Remote & Hybrid Roles
  • Long term & short term disability¬†
  • 401[k] plan
  • 16 Weeks Paid Parental Leave
  • 2 Volunteer days per year
  • Matching Gift Program
  • Participation Grant Program
  • Annual Travel/Team Events up to twice per year (post-COVID)
Our Commitment

We believe that the key to Loyal's success is you. Your unique background, life experience, knowledge, self-expression, and talent make you uniquely you. Who you are, what you have experienced, and how you think inspires us to be innovative and bold.

Loyal is an equal opportunity employer. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, ancestry, sex, gender identity and expression, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, languages spoken, veteran status, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and beliefs.

We consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Further, consistent with applicable federal and state law, Loyal provides reasonable accommodations when requested by qualified applicants or employees with disabilities, unless doing so would cause an undue hardship. Loyal‚Äôs policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodation applies to all aspects of employment, including the application process. If you require a reasonable accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact the Talent Acquisition Department at talentacquisition@loyalhealth.com.

E-Verify
¬†
This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the I-9 Form.¬†¬†¬†

Consistent with Loyal policy, candidates performing in-person work will be required to show proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 upon commencing employment. Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable law. If you require a reasonable accommodation to Loyal‚Äôs vaccination requirement, please contact the People Department at people@loyalhealth.com.

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
Sequence exists to magically simplify financial operations for modern companies.

At the end of your career, we want you to look back at your time with Sequence and say it was the best job you ever had.¬†

We're remote within +/-5¬† hours of GMT, or you can work from our Hub in central London.

The role

results.title: Growth Product Manager, Matcha
results.description:
COMPANY

At 0x Labs, our mission is to create a tokenized world where all value can flow freely. We‚Äôre a mission-driven and diverse team composed of world class talent from Coinbase, Google, Meta, Bitso, Citi, Spotify and other top companies. We are a remote-first and fully distributed company, with team members located across all of the continents besides Antarctica. As early pioneers in the space, we‚Äôve made significant technical contributions to various Ethereum standards over the years; fun fact - our team helped establish the NFT token standard (ERC721).

In joining us, you'll take part in transforming the way that value is exchanged on a global scale. We're passionate about open-source software and decentralized technology's potential to act as an equalizing force in the world, and our technology is deployed by a wide array of projects at the forefront of internet and economic advancement.

Founded in 2017, 0x Labs created and now partakes in the development of 0x protocol: the open-source, global backbone for decentralized exchange. Alongside the core protocol, we also build and maintain products and service offerings including Matcha, the search engine for tokens, and 0x API, the endpoint for multi-chain aggregated liquidity. All of these offerings allow 0x Labs to continue marching towards our vision of building a tokenized world where all value can flow freely at the best prices and with the lowest transaction costs. This way, we can help businesses eliminate the complexity of accessing decentralized markets across all layers of the Web3 exchange stack and have more time to focus on what matters most: their product.¬†

0x currently supports 8 major blockchains: Ethereum, Polygon, Fantom, Avalanche, Arbitrum, Optimism, BNB Chain, and Celo, and the 0x ecosystem has been rapidly expanding. With integrations across all of the top wallets and apps, including MetaMask, Coinbase Wallet and Coinbase NFT, Polygon Wallet, Brave, Matcha, dYdX, Zapper, Zerion, and Shapeshift, 0x is fast becoming the trusted standard for all decentralized exchange.

We‚Äôre a remote-first company with core contributors in nearly ten countries and over twice as many cities. Our headquarters is in San Francisco, with an office available for anyone on the team to use at any time. We‚Äôll consider your application regardless of where you call home.


MATCHA

Matcha is 0x Labs‚Äô first consumer product. It is a meticulously designed decentralized exchange that makes it easy for anyone in the world to access crypto assets on the Ethereum blockchain safely. Powered by the 0x API, we provide users with the best prices by aggregating liquidity from all of the major decentralized exchanges and splitting/routing orders intelligently.

By focusing on user experience and education, Matcha will onboard the next wave of users into the DeFi ecosystem. As a Growth Product Manager on the team, you‚Äôll take large and early part in building and scaling this flagship product.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead and guide product direction for a cross-functional team of engineers and designers
  • Drive a product-led growth culture
  • Research and intimately understand our target users and our product funnel. Translate growth opportunities into short-, medium-, and long-term product roadmaps that will have a direct positive impact on Matcha‚Äôs growth
  • Design, run and interpret experiments and A/B tests
  • Craft metrics that accurately reflect Matcha‚Äôs growth goals
  • Clearly communicate your team's priorities and product roadmap with leadership stakeholders and drive alignment across multiple teams in scrappy ways


REQUIREMENTS

  • At least 3 years of Growth Product Management experience working with consumer products preferably in crypto, fin-tech startups or gaming
  • You have taken a product from 0 to scale, ideally in consumer tech or fin-tech
  • Have a growth mindset and experience using research, experimentation and product analytics to make product changes that improve conversion
  • Familiarity with crypto/web3 and DeFi. Some would say you are a power user
  • Deep analytical expertise; you will partner with our data science team, but you should be able to perform basic data analysis/querying skills yourself
  • Strong communication and writing skills
  • Passion for the benefits of decentralization and the 0x mission
  • Exhibit our core values: do the right thing, consistently ship, and focus on long-term impact

BENEFITS

  • Competitive salary and equity with occasional cryptocurrency-based perks
  • Comprehensive insurance (medical/dental/vision/life/disability) ‚Äî 100% covered for you and dependents
  • 401k, HSA, and FSA for U.S.-based employees
  • Monthly mobile phone bill, wellness, and pre-tax transportation expense
  • Covered mental health benefits (included professional therapy sessions)
  • Flexible hours, liberal work-from-home policy, and a supportive remote environment
  • Lunch reimbursement for all employees across the globe!
  • Stipend for your ideal remote / WFH set-up: laptop, headphones, and any other work gear you may need
  • 12-week paid parental leave
  • Great office conveniently located in Soma/East Cut, SF
  • Unlimited vacation: Take time when you need it (and we really mean it)
  • Multiple annual in-person team meet-ups around the globe

0x Labs and its associated entities (0x) are dedicated to fostering diversity, inclusion, and belonging in its teams and workforce, and are proud to be equal opportunity employers. 0x does not make employment or hiring decisions on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression or identity, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, national origin, or any other basis that is protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. 0x will also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in a way that is consistent with San Francisco‚Äôs Fair Chance Ordinance and similar local laws.

results.description:
About Magic Square

Recent Publications

TechCrunch

The Block

CoinTelegraph

Binance Blog

About our Team

The people¬†behind Magic Square are first-class industry professionals, blockchain veterans, experienced software developers, and seasoned crypto enthusiasts. Our ultimate goal is to reshape the crypto app experience, bringing decentralized applications, cryptocurrencies, and Web3.0 to every business possible.

You‚Äôll get more than just working experience at MagicSquare. You‚Äôll join a vast network of entrepreneurs and technologists across the globe.

#PeopleFirstAlways

Diversity, equality, and inclusion play a crucial role in everything we do - from how we build our products to how we build our team.

Our company is still young but we are 100% committed to creating a workplace where all people are valued, respected, and encouraged to be themselves.

Regardless of visible or invisible differences, we foster a culture where everyone has an equal opportunity to reach their full potential and to be heard and valued. And yes, we may not always get everything right along the way and there is still work to do, but we are willing to listen,
share, learn, and do it better together.¬†

About the Role:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Social Media Manager to join our team at Magic Square. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in managing social media channels for crypto or Web3 projects, as well as a passion for staying up-to-date on the latest trends in the industry.

In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing a social media strategy that supports the overall marketing and communication goals of the company. This will include creating engaging content for social media platforms, monitoring and responding to comments and messages, and analyzing metrics to identify areas for improvement.

To be successful in this role, you should have a strong understanding of how to effectively use social media platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram to reach target audiences. You should also have excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as the ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.

If you are a self-starter with a proven track record of success in social media management for crypto or Web3 projects, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please include a cover letter and resume highlighting your relevant experience and skills.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute a social media strategy that aligns with the overall marketing and communication goals of the company.
  • Create and publish engaging content for social media platforms, including text, images, and video.
  • Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and reviews on social media channels.

  • Analyze social media metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimize the social media strategy as needed.
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest social media trends and best practices, and identify opportunities to incorporate them into the social media strategy.
  • Create and manage social media campaigns, including the development of targeting, budget, and creative assets.
  • Manage and maintain a content calendar for social media channels.
  • Collaborate with influencers and industry partners to amplify reach and engagement.
  • Monitor and report on the performance of social media campaigns and initiatives.

The ideal candidate - who you are and requirements:

  • A bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field.
  • 2-3 years of experience in social media management, preferably for a brand or organization in the crypto or Web3 space.
  • Fluent English Speaker.¬†
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create engaging content for a variety of social media platforms.
  • Proficiency in other languages is a plus.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to use data to inform decision-making.
  • Proficiency with social media management tools such as Zoho Social.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects concurrently.
  • Knowledge of the latest social media trends and best practices.
  • Experience with content creation tools such as Figma.
  • Familiarity with image and video editing software is a plus.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Sounds like a challenge you'd like to take on? Then apply now!

Benefits:

True to the motto "Take care of your employees, and they'll take care of your business", you'll find a lot of good things in working with us. For example:

  • Work remotely from anywhere in the world
  • Company events and celebrations
  • A fast-paced, challenging, and one-of-a-kind business sector
  • Flat company and international work environment
  • Excellent opportunities for advancement in a growing organization
  • Possibility of international transfers and relocation mid-career
  • Competitive payment and compensation in the form of Tokens - you grow with the company
  • At Magic Square, you‚Äôll be empowered to work on things that you‚Äôre passionate about. You‚Äôll be given autonomy. Your ideas matter!

If you're still hesitating because you don't think you're a 100% fit for the job, THEN APPLY ANYWAYS and we'll have a chat! Maybe you've got more potential than you think ;)

We are looking forward to connecting with you!¬†

results.title: Risk Product Manager
results.description:
Who we are

Sendwave is on a mission to make sending funds to loved ones as easy and affordable as sending a text. What makes us stand out in a sea of similar apps? We deeply care about the diasporas and communities we serve ‚Äî and that comes with a sense of connection to the markets we operate in. We strive to make life better for everyone who touches our product. That means recognizing and honoring the human experience behind sending money. We do that by remaining fee-free in most of our markets and offering round-the-clock customer care.

Our app is currently available in the United States, United Kingdom, Canada, and parts of Europe, and sends funds to 19 receiving countries for over 500,000 users. We currently have a 4.6-star rating on Trustpilot ‚Äî people put their faith in us to deliver their money quickly, securely, and affordably. And we‚Äôre pretty darn proud of that.

How we work

What we‚Äôre most proud of though is our brilliant, creative, and tenacious team. Our remote-first workplace means you‚Äôll be working with Sendwavers in Europe, Africa, South America, and the U.S. that all share a core set of Sendwave values. What exactly are those values? Glad you asked.

  1. Prioritize fearlessly.
     There will always be more problems to solve and opportunities to pursue than we have the capacity for. We‚Äôre not afraid to say no and are willing to let fires burn, knowing that to win we must discern and execute decisively on the vital few rather than the important many.
  2. Take full ownership of the outcomes we‚Äôre responsible for.
    Our job is not to do what we can to solve a problem. It's to ensure that problem is solved. If an attempt to solve a problem doesn't work, we seek an alternative. If we need help, we request it, and, if necessary, demand it.
  3. Forge a diverse team and inclusive culture.
    We believe the challenges we‚Äôre addressing will be best met by a truly global, diverse team, working together. We‚Äôre not naive to the systemic bias and discrimination that make this easier said than done, so we check our egos, listen deeply, and measure progress towards making this a fundamental part of our success.
  4. Maximize our rate of learning.
    We view projects as ever-evolving drafts and welcome opportunities to discover that what we had in mind won't work so we can move to an even better end state. Most importantly, we do this fast. The faster we run these loops ‚Äî as a company and individuals ‚Äî the faster we‚Äôll achieve our mission.
  5. Embrace embarrassing honesty from ourselves and others.
    We function best when we're open and honest with one another ‚Äî especially about our challenges and doubts. We lean into uncomfortable conversations and support our colleagues when they do the same.
  6. Maximize energy, not time spent.
    We measure our own and others‚Äô contributions by objectives reached, not time spent. Living a full life outside of work is necessary for high achievement over the long term.

¬†

How you‚Äôll help us achieve it

If you‚Äôve ever seen The Tinder Swindler , FYRE, or The Wizard of Lies you know fraud is an infinitely repeating social struggle that leaves the most vulnerable to pay the price. The Risk team at Sendwave builds and supports everything needed to aggregate the individual fraud cases and stop the scheme from ever being lucrative for the fraudster.

Being the Risk Product Manager will include many typical tasks like exploring vendor tools, coordinating large projects across teams and communicating the status of fraud throughout the company. However, a successful Risk Product Manager will be the creative genius behind the next generation of user verification techniques.

After the targeted Data Science defenses have detected a potential fraud case the user has the opportunity to move through one of our verification processes and unblock themselves, typically this looks like submitting an ID or speaking with a Support Rep. We would like to expand our suit of verification techniques by 5x through:

  • creative understanding of our fraudsters
  • careful rollout and rollback verification processes
  • a data-based understanding of the effectiveness
  • ‚ÄúUser Self-Serve‚Äù automations wherever possible

Want to learn more about our hiring process for this role? Please access our HIRING PLAYBOOK HERE

What you bring to the table:
  • Clear communication skills and understanding of how to implement new experiments, making complex tradeoffs about what‚Äôs best for our users and our business thoughtfully and collaboratively.
  • A love for solving hard puzzles with solutions that make others question your mental sanity.
  • a knack for tinkering with A/B testing, statistical analysis, and other quantitative techniques to understand how we can optimize and improve key business metrics.
  • A degree (or equivalent experience) in a quantitative or technical field such as statistics, math, economics, and computer science. Sharp data analytics skills (including SQL) are critical.
  • Strong project management skills and can plan, coordinate, and track multiple experiments simultaneously.
  • A willingness to travel four weeks out of the year to meet with your team and the rest of the company (global pandemics permitting).

¬†

Bonus points if you have:
  • a creative approach to challenges.
  • the ability to pick up new concepts quickly.
  • flexibility and the ability to handle ambiguity gracefully.
Let's talk about the benefits. Here are a few perks you can look forward to:
  • Location: Our company is 100% remote. You can be based anywhere in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Belgium, Poland, Kenya, Rwanda, Senegal, or South Africa. We will consider contractors in countries not listed on a case-by-case basis.
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Major benefits:
    • Subsidized health insurance and retirement contribution matching (both vary from country to country)
    • 26 weeks of fully paid parental leave and subsidized fertility assistance
    • Unlimited vacation with a 20-day minimum requirement
    • $10,000 annual charitable donation matching
And best of all:
  • Our team of over 400 employees is fully distributed across the world. We are working from coffee shops, homes, and co-working spaces ‚Äî making us one of the larger fully distributed growth-stage startups in the world.
  • We are proud parents, community organizers, farmers, band members, yoga teachers, YouTube influencers, former Olympians, and serial entrepreneurs.
  • We collectively speak over twenty languages, including Akuapem, Amharic, Bengali, Ewe, Fante, Ga, Igbo, Kalenjin, Luganda, Oromo, Somali, Swahili, Wolof, Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Irish, Italian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Maltese, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish and Swedish.
  • We recently joined forces with WorldRemit, another remittance company. We‚Äôre excited about the ways we can collaborate and continue to provide the best service to our users.
Ready to apply?

results.title: Director of Growth
results.description:
About Ceremonia:

Ceremonia is a fast growing, venture funded clean hair care brand rooted in Latinx heritage. We are on a mission to empower a wellness approach to hair, manifesting modern day rituals stemming from rich culture that feed your hair from the roots and beyond. The company is founded and led by award-winning business professional and fellow Latina Babba Rivera and supported by top tier DTC, beauty, e-commerce and tech investors.

Role overview:

Ceremonia is seeking an analytical and entrepreneurial leader to define and execute Ceremonia‚Äôs growth strategy. In this capacity, you will own the roadmap to accelerate Ceremonia‚Äôs already rapid growth (on track to 3x+ two years in a row) - building growth loops, validating and scaling new acquisition/retention tactics, owning channel-by-channel ROI analysis (CAC, LTV, AOV), and delivering a luxury user experience to Ceremonia‚Äôs existing customer base. We‚Äôre committed to investing in scale - as you unlock new growth levers, your team and budget will expand.

As Director of Growth Marketing, you‚Äôll define the roadmap and vision for how more people establish their own modern day rituals with Ceremonia. You are a curious and analytical self-starter, with a demonstrable track record of experience in paid and organic acquisition (Facebook, Instagram, Google Shopping, SEO), retention (CRM, referral, loyalty programs), and segmentation/personalization. You‚Äôre excited to test the newest channels for growing an audience (SMS, TikTok, video testimonials), and know the data needed to either disqualify or further invest in a channel.

We‚Äôre the first Latinx clean hair brand to be featured in Sephora (with a nationwide rollout around the corner), and are a diverse, creative team looking for someone who shares our values. We offer competitive compensation and benefits as well as equity.

¬†

Reports to: C-Suite

¬†

Responsibilities:

  • Define and own the growth marketing roadmap, including:

  • Testing and scaling paid and organic channels for acquisition and retention

  • Reporting revenue analytics at top level & across campaigns and channels (CAC, LTV, RFM model)

  • Define customer lifecycle journeys; owning strategy, building triggered/event-based and one-off email sequences, and testing new touchpoints (e.g. SMS)

  • Lead concept to completion launches for buyer retention and reactivation, such as referral, shopper loyalty, discounts/incentives

  • Own segmentation and personalization, customizing shopper experience to where they are in their Ceremonia journey

  • Forecasting sales performance and define annual targets

  • Owning paid marketing spend ‚Äì as you prove ROI, your budget will scale

  • As channels scale, build and manage a team

  • Manage customer segmentation strategy and develop smart attribution modeling, ensuring we reach the right audience with the right message, at the right place and time

¬†

Requirements:

  • Demonstrable experience in designing and implementing successful paid marketing campaigns

  • Hands on experience with SEO/SEM, Facebook, Google Analytics, lifecycle marketing, and CRM software

  • Excellent analytical and project management skills with strong detail orientation

  • Strong team management and communication skills

  • Experience managing large yearly budgets, while still maintaining a scrappy startup mentality

  • 5+ years of experience in fast-moving, direct-to-consumer environments or performance marketing agencies focusing on growth and acquisition marketing

¬†

Nice to have:

  • Familiarity with Shopify

  • Proficiency in SQL

¬†

Ceremonia Benefits (for U.S. Based Employees)

  • Competitive comp package (base + bonus + stock options)

  • Health insurance (medical, vision & dental)

  • Collaboration: You have a voice here!¬† If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it‚Äôs a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving.¬† Our executive team holds town halls & company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.

The ‚ÄúFlashy‚Äù Perks:
